par.text: Fluorine is a greenish-yellow gas with a sharp odour, severely irritating to the respiratory tract. It is slightly denser than air. Fluorine is one of the most reactive substances known. It combines with nearly all elements to form fluorides. The exceptions are: chlorine, nitrogen and certain noble gases (helium and neon). Fluorine reacts explosively with hydrogen to produce hydrogen fluoride, even at very low temperatures. The element was discovered in 1771 by the Swedish chemist Karl Wilhelm Scheele.
